title: JSON schema for Google Apps Script manifest files

runtimeVersion.description: Version of the server to use when executing this project.

timeZone.description: The script time zone in one of the available ZoneId values such as "America/Denver".

dependencies.description: A list of advanced services and libraries.

enabledAdvancedServices.description: The list of advanced services enabled for use by the script project.

userSymbol.description: The identifier used to refer to this service in the code of the Apps Script project.

serviceId.description: The identifier of the service that is shown in the API discovery document (e.g., drive).

version.description: The enabled version of the service (e.g., "v1").

userSymbol.description: The label that is used in the script project code to refer to this library.

libraryId.description: The script ID of the library's script project. You can find a script ID in the library script's URL or in the script editor by selecting **File > Project properties**.

version.description: The version of the library that is used by the script. This is either a version number or stable, meaning the last version created.

developmentMode.description: If true, version is ignored and the script uses the current library project saved code, even if that code has not been saved to a new version.

webapp.description: The script project's web app configuration. Only used if the project is deployed as a web app.

access.description: The levels of permission for running the web app.

exceptionLogging.description: The location where exceptions are logged.

oauthScopes.description: The definition of authorization scopes used by the script project.

urlFetchWhitelist.description: A list of HTTPS URL prefixes. If present, any URL endpoint fetched must match one of the prefixes in this list. This can help to protect user data.

executionApi.description: The script project's API executable configuration. Only used if the project is deployed for API execution.

access.description: Determines who has permission to run the script from the API.

sheets.description: Defines manifest values specific to Sheets.

macros.description: A list of defined macros and their associated properties.

items.description: A defined macros and it's associated properties.

menuName.description: The name of the macro as it appears in the Google Sheets UI.

functionName.description: The name of the Apps Script function that executes the macro. By default this matches the menuName for functions automatically created, but this is not a requirement.

defaultShortcut.description: Defines the keyboard shortcut that executes the macro. This must be of the form Ctrl+Alt+Shift+Number, where Number is a single-digit. Macros without shortcuts can only be executed from the Tools > Macros menu.
